item.title: Wilson (Weixin) Cai
item.description: I obtained my Ph.D. in Biostatistics at UC Berkeley. I am fortunate to be advised by Professors Mark van der Laan and Alan Hubbard. My research interests lie in Machine Learning and Causal Inference. I graduated from the Univeristy of Hong Kong with a B.Sc. (Honors) in Statistics and double major in Finance. I was awarded the Saw Gold Medal in Statistics (magna cum laude) and Undergraduate Research Fellowship during my graduation at HKU.

item.title: Experience
item.description: SELECTED AWARDS Outstanding Graduate Student Instructor, 03/2017 University of California, Berkeley JSM Student Travel Awards, SF Bay Area Chapter of the ASA, 04/2016 [News] SFASA Saw Gold Medal in Statistics, 04/2016 University of Hong Kong Saw See Hock Statistics Scholarship, 02/2016 University of Hong Kong Undergraduate Research Fellowship & Overseas Research Internship Award, 01/2014 University of Hong Kong C.V. Starr Scholarship, 2013 University of Hong Kong

item.title: Research
item.description: Publications Cai, Weixin and van der Laan, Mark J., ``One-step targeted maximum likelihood estimator for survival curve”, To appear in Targeted Learning in Data Science: Causal Inference for Complex Longitudinal Studies. Springer, 2016. Cai, Weixin and van der Laan, Mark J., ``One-step targeted maximum likelihood for time-to-event outcomes”, In preparation, 2016. Cai, Weixin and Hubbard, Alan E., ``Data-adaptive statistics for multiple hypothesis testing in high-dimensional settings”, In preparation, 2016.

item.title: Software
item.description: TMLEbootstrap: Bootstrap Confidence Intervals For Targeted Maximum Likelihood Estimators MOSS (Model One-Step Survival): one-step TMLE for survival curve ctmle3: A modern implementation of the Collaborative Targeted Maximum Likelihood Estimator (C-TMLE) algorithm

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Courses Taught PH 290: Big Data in Biostatistics, ([Spring, 2016](), Spring, 2017) with Prof. Lexin Li Courses TA’ed PH 295: Targeted Learning with Biomedical Big Data, (Fall, 2016) with Prof. Mark J. van der Laan
